This revised clause maintains a professional tone but shifts the focus from the initial agreements (premises and mutual covenants) to the subsequent ones (reciprocal commitments). This subtle change suggests a more forward-looking approach in the contract.

This revised clause subtly shifts the responsibility from the client to ensure the product is approved for sale within their region, to Accuray ensuring that the products are only sold in regions where they have received official approval.

original: 2. DISTRIBUTORSHIP 2.1. Appointment . Accuray hereby appoints Distributor as a  non-exclusive, worldwide distributor of Products and Services to Customers solely in connection with Multiple LINAC or Multi -Modality Purchases, not to  the exclusion of Accuray itself or any of its other current or future  distributors and subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement.  By way of clarification, this Agreement does  not relate to any Cayman Product, including, without limitation, the  distribution or sale thereof or any services related thereto.
ollama_generated:
2. DISTRIBUTION (2.1. Appointment)

Distributor is hereby granted a non-exclusive, worldwide distribution right for the Products and Services, exclusively for Multiple LINAC or Multi-Modality purchase contracts by Customers, without prejudice to Accuray's own rights or those of any other current or future distributors. This distribution authority does not extend to Cayman Products; specifically, it excludes any involvement in the distribution, sale, or provision of services related to these products as per the terms and conditions set forth in this Agreement.

original: 2.3.3. Purchase . To purchase Products or Services based on a  Quote provided by Accuray, Distributor will issue a purchase order, which shall  include specific references to the quote number of such Quote (the “Purchase  Order”). Accuray shall either accept or reject such Purchase Order within  two weeks after receipt thereof, with any failure to approve or disapprove of such Purchase Order in such period constituting disapproval.  Each purchase of Accuray Components and  Interfaces shall be accomplished and a Purchase Order may be accepted by the  execution of the Purchase Order by an authorized representative of  Accuray.  To the extent of any  inconsistency between the Quote and the related Purchase Order, the terms and  conditions of such Quote shall govern and Distributor acknowledges and agrees  that Accuray shall not be bound by any terms, conditions or boilerplate  language included in a Distributor purchase order submitted to Accuray.
ollama_generated:
2.3.3. Purchase Procedure. The Distributor may initiate the purchase of Products or Services from Accuray by submitting a request for quote (the "Request"). Upon receiving an acceptable Request, Accuray will issue a corresponding quote number (the "Quote Number") and provide a quotation (the "Quotation"). The Distributor shall then have two weeks to respond with a definitive purchase intention by issuing a purchase order (the "Purchase Order"), referencing the Quote Number.

In case no response is received from the Distributor within this period, Accuray reserves the right to consider the purchase request as withdrawn. If the Purchase Order is issued, Accuray shall have up to two weeks to review and respond, failing which the Purchase Order will be deemed approved. Each purchase of Accuray Components and Interfaces shall require the execution of a Purchase Order by an authorized representative of Accuray.

In case of any discrepancies between the Quotation and the subsequent Purchase Order, the terms and conditions of the original Quotation will prevail. The Distributor acknowledges and agrees that any additional terms, conditions or boilerplate language included in a Distributor purchase order submitted to Accuray will not be binding on Accuray unless explicitly agreed upon in writing by an authorized representative of Accuray.

original: 3.2. Market Knowledge, Promotion  and Sales . Distributor  will develop a thorough and complete understanding of the Products and Services. Distributor will use its knowledge and understanding to identify and  cultivate potential Customers.  Distributor agrees to use commercially reasonable efforts to introduce,  promote the sale of, and obtain orders for the Products and Services in  connection with Multiple LINAC or Multi -Modality Purchases, including, without  limitation, including the Products and Services in each of Distributor ’s Oncology Care Systems price  book and sales operation system, such that all of Distributor ’s sales  representatives can access quotations for Products and Services at least as  easily as all other systems then available for purchase from Distributor. Moreover, Distributor represents and  warrants that, on the date hereof and during the Term of this Agreement and any  extension thereof, it (i) possesses the knowledge, experience, skills, and  ability required to properly fulfill its obligations under this Agreement; and (ii) has the required facilities, manpower, capacity, financial strength, and knowledge  to market and distribute Accuray ’s Products and Services in connection with  Multiple LINAC or Multi -Modality Purchases .
ollama_generated: 3.2. Market Understanding, Promotion, and Sales Responsibilities: Supplier shall provide the Distributor with essential information regarding the Products and Services. It will be the responsibility of the Distributor to acquire this knowledge, though not necessarily in-depth or exhaustive, as needed to interact with potential Customers. The Distributor acknowledges a flexible commitment towards advertising, facilitating sales, and procuring orders for the Products and Services, particularly in relation to Multiple LINAC or Multi-Modality Purchase contracts. However, the Supplier does not obligate the Distributor to include these products systematically in all pricing structures or sales operation systems. The Supplier also does not require that Distributor's sales representatives have easy access to Products and Services quotations, but such access should be feasible given the current resources available for purchasing from the Supplier. Moreover, Supplier makes no assurance regarding the Distributor's qualifications or capabilities to fulfill its obligations under this Agreement, nor does it guarantee that the Distributor possesses the necessary facilities, personnel, capacity, financial stability, and knowledge required to market and distribute the Supplier's Products and Services in connection with Multiple LINAC or Multi-Modality Purchases.

original: 3.11.1. Compliance Generally . Distributor  has and will  have during the Term of this Agreement and any extension thereof the ability to distribute, market and sell the Products and Services in accordance with the  terms of this Agreement, in full compliance with all governmental, regulatory  and other requirements under any applicable law. Furthermore, Distributor  agrees to comply with all applicable international, national, regional and  local laws applicable to the performance of its duties hereunder or to any  transactions involving the Products or Services contemplated hereunder.
modified: 3.11.1. Permissive Distribution. The Distributor shall retain, but not be obliged to exercise, during the Term of this Agreement and any extensions thereof, the discretion to distribute, market, and sell the Products and Services in accordance with the terms of this Agreement. However, such actions shall be undertaken in a manner that may not be inconsistent with all governmental, regulatory, and other requirements under any applicable law. It is understood that the Distributor is under no obligation to comply with all applicable international, national, regional, or local laws governing its performance of duties hereunder or transactions involving the Products or Services contemplated hereunder, except where such compliance is expressly required by this Agreement or mandated by law.

original: 4.12. Distributor Personnel Sales  Training . Accuray  shall provide training of Distributor ’s sales personnel responsible for sales  of Products and Services to Distributor free of charge. original: 6.2. Termination .
ollama_generated:
6.2. Suspension of Obligations and Services .

Upon either Party's written request to the other, the receiving Party shall have the option to temporarily pause its obligations under this Agreement for a period not exceeding thirty (30) calendar days, if it reasonably believes that performance of such obligations would cause it undue hardship. In such event, the non-requesting Party shall be responsible for accommodating and mitigating any resulting inconvenience or loss to the fullest extent possible. This provision does not absolve either Party from its long-term commitments or obligations under this Agreement.

original: 9.1. Notice of Infringement . Distributor undertakes to inform Accuray  without undue delay if it first becomes aware of any possible infringement by  third parties of Accuray ’s proprietary rights, including, without limitation, a  duplication of the Products or any other patent, trademark or copyright or  other infringement of Accuray ’s intellectual property rights in connection with  the Products, and to cooperate with Accuray at Accuray ’s sole expense regarding  any legal action in relation to such infringement, which in Accuray’s judgment,  is necessary or desirable.
ollama_generated: 9.1. Notice of Potential Infringement: The Distributor shall have a reasonable period of time to become apprised of any suspected infringement by third parties of Accuray's proprietary rights, primarily regarding the duplication of Products or any other patent, trademark, copyright, or violation of Accuray's intellectual property rights associated with the Products. The Distributor's cooperation in any legal action initiated by Accuray, relating to such infringement, will be facilitated at the expense of Accuray, provided that the Distributor is given the opportunity to consult its own legal counsel prior to such cooperation, and unless the Distributor deems such cooperation to be against its best interests.

Any changes made by the Distributor must be previously agreed upon in writing by Accuray, otherwise, such alterations may result in a breach of this Agreement, which Accuray may choose to address at its discretion. The non-compliance with these labeling provisions by Distributor may lead to a material default under the terms of this Agreement, but shall not be grounds for immediate termination without prior written notice.

original: Distributor shall not remove  copyright notices or any trademarks from the Products.  Distributor shall not be entitled to use said trademarks in conjunction with Distributor ’s own trademarks or for any other  purpose, except in the manner authorized by Accuray, which authorization will  not be unreasonably withheld and in compliance with distribution standards and  specifications established by Accuray.  If Accuray determines in its sole discretion that Distributor is not  meeting such standards and specifications, Distributor shall immediately, at Accuray ’s instructions, take all steps necessary to ensure that such standards and  specifications are met or cease all further use and display of the  trademarks.  In the event of expiration  or termination of this Agreement, Distributor shall immediately discontinue all  use of Accuray ’s trademarks except for the sale of Distributor ’s inventory of  Products.
ollama_generated:
Distributor is authorized to utilize Accuray's trademarks in conjunction with the distribution of the Products, strictly adhering to the specific guidelines and standards set forth by Accuray. However, such use shall not extend to incorporating Accuray's trademarks with Distributor's own trademarks or for any purposes other than those explicitly approved by Accuray. Any use of Accuray's trademarks beyond the scope of this authorization requires express permission from Accuray, which will be granted unless there are compelling reasons to the contrary.

In the event that Distributor fails to meet the distribution standards and specifications established by Accuray, as determined by Accuray in its sole discretion, Distributor shall promptly make any necessary adjustments at Accuray's instruction or discontinue the use and display of the trademarks. Upon expiration or termination of this Agreement, Distributor may continue to use Accuray's trademarks solely for the purpose of selling off Distributor's inventory of Products.

In addition, Distributor is required to maintain the copyright notices and any trademarks on the Products as originally provided by Accuray. The removal or alteration of these marks is prohibited.

original: 10. INDEMNITIES.
ollama_generated:
10. PROTECTIVE MEASURES AND LIMITATION OF LIABILITY.

In the event that any third party claim, action, or proceeding (a "Claim") arises against the Indemnified Party in connection with this Agreement or its performance, the Indemnifying Party shall be solely responsible for, and hereby agrees to defend, indemnify, and hold harmless the Indemnified Party from and against any and all losses, damages, liabilities, costs (including reasonable attorneys' fees), and expenses arising out of or in connection with such Claim. However, the Indemnifying Party's obligation to defend, indemnify, and hold harmless shall be limited to and conditioned upon: (i) the Indemnified Party giving prompt written notice of any such Claim to the Indemnifying Party; (ii) the Indemnifying Party having full control over the defense and settlement of the Claim; and (iii) the Indemnifying Party being provided with all reasonable assistance, at the Indemnifying Party's expense, in connection with the defense or settlement of such Claim. Furthermore, under no circumstances shall the Indemnifying Party be liable for indirect, special, incidental, punitive, or consequential damages resulting from or in any way related to a Claim.

original: 10.3. Injunctions . If Distributor ’s rights to use and distribute  a Product under the terms of this Agreement are, or in Accuray ’s opinion are likely to be, enjoined due to the type of claim specified in Section 10.1  (Accuray Indemnity), then Accuray may, at its sole option and expense: (i) procure  for Distributor the right to continue to use and distribute such Product under  the terms of this Agreement;
modified: 10.3. Injunctions. If, in Distributor's opinion, there is a likelihood that its rights to use and distribute a Product under the terms of this Agreement may be enjoined due to the type of claim specified in Section 10.1 (Distributor Indemnity), then it is solely responsible for, at its own expense: (i) securing the right to continue using and distributing such Product under the terms of this Agreement; provided that Accuray shall not be obligated to assist in this process unless expressly requested by Distributor.

original: 10.6. Distributor Indemnity . Distributor will defend or settle, indemnify  and hold Accuray harmless from any liability, damages and expenses (including  court costs and reasonable attorneys ’ fees) to the extent based upon a  third -party claim based on or otherwise attributable to: (i) Distributor ’s acts or omissions not in accordance with this Agreement or (ii) any  misrepresentations made by Distributor with respect to Accuray or the Products  or Services.
modified:
10.6. Accuray Indemnity. Accuray will have the right, at its sole discretion, to defend or seek resolution, indemnify, and hold Distributor harmless from any liability, damages, and expenses (including court costs and reasonable attorneys' fees) arising from a third-party claim that may result from: (i) misrepresentations made by Accuray with respect to the Distributor or its operations, or (ii) actions or inactions taken by Distributor in accordance with this Agreement. This indemnification obligation shall not extend to liabilities, damages, or expenses arising from Distributor's gross negligence or willful misconduct.

In this revised version, the obligations of the Distributor have been weakened and shifted towards Accuray. The distributor is no longer obligated to defend or settle claims but has the right at its discretion. Also, the indemnification obligation does not extend to liabilities arising from gross negligence or willful misconduct by the Distributor.

original: 11.1. Liability for Death or  Injury . The liability of any party  with respect to death or injury to any person is subject to and governed by the provisions of applicable law.
ollama_generated: 11.1. Responsibility for Death or Injury: Any potential responsibility arising from death or injury to any individual shall be exclusively determined and addressed in accordance with the pertinent legal statutes applicable to such situations.

original: 12.10. Waiver . The waiver of any breach or default of any  provision of this Agreement will not constitute a waiver of any other right hereunder or of any subsequent breach or default.

original: 12.11. Severability . If any provision of this Agreement is held  invalid or unenforceable by a court of competent jurisdiction, the remaining provisions of the Agreement will remain in full force and effect, and the  provision affected will be construed so as to be enforceable to the maximum  extent permissible by law.
ollama_generated: 12.11. original: 5 Color Usually white label with black printing other colors are allowed as  long as barcode/plain text can be read Barcode content 1P <Material No. > S <Serial No.> Additionally for packaging only 2P <product Revision> Q <quantity of products in this packaging (numeric only), usually  1> It is not allowed to label Revision and Quantity on product  identification labels! e.g.: 1P01234567 as barcode *)  (1P) Model No. 01234567 S1001 as barcode *)  (S) Serial No. 1001 Each symbol structure with start and stop character including Data  Identifier (e.g. “1P” or “S”), but without symbol check character.
ollama_generated:
5. Labeling Requirements:

As a general rule, labels should predominantly be white with black text; however, alternative colors are acceptable if they do not interfere with the readability of the barcode and plain text. The barcode content must adhere to the format 1P <Material No.> S <Serial No.>, although modifications to this format may be made for packaging purposes, such as 2P <product Revision> Q <quantity of products in this packaging (numeric only), usually 1. It is essential that the model number and quantity are not labeled on product identification labels, but can appear within the barcode, for example: 012345671P S1001 or S100101234567 as barcodes. The symbol structure must include a start character (e.g., "1P" or "S"), an end character, and the data identifier, but should not contain a symbol check character.

original: It is not allowed to print any  other information in the barcode fields described above.
ollama_generated: The barcode fields as described above shall be exclusively reserved for the intended purpose, without encroachment by any additional data or information.

original: AAAAAAAAAA For a transition period  the batch can also be fixed above the material  number Universe, if not possible use similar font (e.g. Helvetica) *) In case of limited space, it is possible to print  the bar code next to (and not under) the clear text.
ollama_generated:
For a transitional phase, there may be instances where the batch labeling exceeds the designated material number "Universe." In such cases, it is acceptable to slightly surpass this limit, provided that the font remains legible and comparable in nature (for example, Arial or Helvetica).

In circumstances of restricted printing space, the barcode may be positioned adjacent to, rather than beneath, the clear text, ensuring readability and compliance with space constraints.

However, adherence to the fundamental packaging specifications, particularly for spare parts, remains paramount for the global logistics process. Notably, suitable packaging for spare parts is imperative, but it should be noted that for any packaging containing wood, alternatives compliant with IPPC (International Plant Protection Convention) – i.e., "wood-free packaging" – are preferred. It is important to clarify that fumigation of such "wood-free packaging" is strictly prohibited.
